text: it rained through the night in Chennai
India's fourth largest city as
experiences heaviest rainfall in more
than a hundred years with the rain not
letting up much of the city is now under
water these pictures sent to us by local
residents showed the extent of the
devastation navigating through the
flooded streets was difficult and at
times dangerous leaving many areas cut
off the airport is closed and train
service is suspended while highways
leading into Chennai are blocked the
Army and Navy have now been deployed to
get to those who are still stranded in
some parts of the city neighborhoods are
under several feet of water and
residents have had to go without food
the power supply in many areas has also
been cut the rain is said to be caused
by a depression in the Bay of Bengal
with more showers expected it's going to
be a while before Chennai clears up son
Jeremy Jones our BBC News Delhi
